report.title: William III, 1698
report.subtitle: Chapter XIX. An Act for the continuing the Imprisonment of Counter and others for the late horrid Conspiracy to assassinate the Person of His Sacred Majesty. [Rot. Parl. 10 Gul. III. p. 4. n. 4]

section.para: Whereas the Persons hereafter named (that is to say) Counter John Bernardi Robert Cassells Robert Meldrum James Chambers and Robert Blackburne have been committed and are still in Custody in Newgate for a detestable traiterous Conspiracy to assassinate the Royall Person of His Majesty Be it enacted by the Kings most Excellent Majesty by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spirituall and Temporall and Commons in Parliament assembled and by the Authority of the same That the said Counter James Bernardi Robert Cassells Robert Meldrum James Chambers and Robert Blackburne shall be detained and kept in Custody without Baile or Mainprize during His Majesties Pleasure.
section.note: This is Cap. XIII. in the common Printed Editions.
